The claim was sourced from a city fact: sheet on immigration and sanctuary cities, which was later acknowledged as a mistake by a city spokeswoman.
The fact: sheet cited a 2015 Greater Philadelphia Chamber of Commerce report, which referenced analysis produced by the Fiscal Policy Institute, stating that immigrant business owners accounted for 96 percent of Main Street business growth in the city from 2000 to 2013.
In the same time span: immigrant entrepreneurs represented 18 percent of Philadelphia's small business growth overall.
Main Street establishments: which include neighborhood services, accommodation and food services, and retail, were identified as the specific types of businesses where immigrant entrepreneurs were more prone to open new businesses due to a lower barrier of entry.
